item.title: Barriers in the middle of the highway, should have no parking cones opposite, 11th August
item.description:
Barriers and hole in the middle of the carriageway. There should be no parking cones opposite to prevent parking as vehicles are parking here causing vehicles and lorries to squeeze through. no permit board so not sure who it belongs to but it has had barrier around it for weeks with no progress.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clock House Road, Elmers End, London

item.title: Rubbish spilling out from recycling bin and rubbish and food waste on public path, 11th August
item.description:
This public path has been disgustingly since tenants moved in. Used nappies on the path. Rubbish in recycling bins. You can see from this picture food waste all over the path with flies flying around it. Please can you contact the freeholder who owns the building as it is not acceptable. There is space in Deronda Road in the building pathway for rubbish / recycling bins and food waste. At the moment in the pathway there is debris and rubbish which should be cleared. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Deronda Road, Tulse Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin Overflow + fly tipping, 11th August
item.description:
To whom it may concern, I am writing to raise a concern regarding the stationary bin located on Colyer’s Lane W3W:///quite.petty.stump. Over recent days, the bin has consistently been overflowing, leading to unsightly and unhygienic conditions. More worryingly, the location W3W:///quite.petty.stump has now begun attracting fly-tipping, with members of the public leaving unwanted household appliances alongside domestic waste. This situation not only impacts the appearance of the area but also poses potential health and safety risks to both residents and passers-by. We would be grateful if you could arrange for the bin to be emptied more frequently and for any illegally dumped items to be removed promptly. Additionally, consideration could be given to measures that discourage further misuse, such as signage, public awareness . Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your response and to seeing improvements in the upkeep of this location. Please see my contact below: email: cordel.roach@gallifordtry.co.uk Number: 07516708692

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Colyers Lane, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 6 Donaldson Road, 11th August
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Donaldson Road, London

item.title: Tree is extremely tall and, if fallen, would destroy part of my house, 11th August
item.description:
To my knowledge the tree had never been pruned. It would certainly destroy part of my house if fallen. Also the route system I believe is going under my house. The trunk is tied to my elderly neighbours’ fence with string. The tree is located on Clare Way, Bexleyheath and is directly behind my and my direct neighbours’ gardens. This has been an issue for several years but the teee just grows and becomes more of a danger each year.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clare Way, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trip hazard on bugsbys way, 11th August
item.description:
At 11.46hrs on 18 July I reported a trip hazard on Bugsbys Way: there were a number of raised paving stones just at the point where people turn left from Sainsburys to walk along Bugsbys Way. Fix My Street reported “Fixed” status at 13.38hrs but when I checked on Saturday 19 July there wasn’t even a paint marker to indicate need for repair. And GUESS WHAT….. IT STILL AIN’T FIXED. There is a road works warning triangle but the traffic cone that was also there a couple of weeks back has disappeared…could be it’s the lonely item now stuck in the middle of the dual carriageway. I’ve measured the paving slabs and some are raised as much as an inch above the others presenting a real trip hazard. Councillors are trumpeting about improving life for pedestrians in Greenwich so PLEASE WILL SOMEONE DO THIS REPAIR BEFORE THERE IS AN ACCIDENT.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bugsby's Way, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet
